Class CircleSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • CircleSet

  • public class CircleSet
extends java.lang.Object
    A Circle set class is designed to read file, which contains number of circles, radius, center points, and colors. Also it counts number of circles, calculates closest center points of the circle, finds out smallest and largest radius, and determines changing brightness.
    Author:
    Adilet Momunaliev

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircleSet(java.io.File source)
      This is constructor CircleSet, which is designed to read properties of the circle and fill the array of the Circle Set width data, which is stored in file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double changingBrightness()
      Determines the overall change in brightness from one Circle to the next Circle.
      Circle[] getClosest()
      Determines pair of Circles, which is located close to each other
      int getCount()
      Count length of the array of the CircleSet
      Circle[] smallLarge()
      Determines smallest and largest radius of Circle within CircleSet
      java.lang.String toString()
      The string version of this CircleSet is designed to put all Circles within CircleSet for output.

      • smallLarge

        public Circle[] smallLarge()
        Determines smallest and largest radius of Circle within CircleSet
        Returns:
        array with smallest and largest radius if Circles have the same radius then returns radius of the Circle with lowest index
